TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 327-328

barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 327-328

div1.p: Dr. Sir Please to let [mutilated] Cook have the Iron I requested you to send me by Mr Overstick (my horse is in a bad way for want of shoes) please to send Stedmas pantaloons. We are out of Coffee and have no Cash at present my wife has sent in 2 pair of socks, I will be much oblige to you for some Coffee, for the value of them;
